title: Which one is better: UltimateGuitar or Songsterr? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ve used them both, but haven’t opened Songster up in years. I think UG is better at making lists you want to keep track of, you can have personal tabs, when you transcribe a song they will look up the lyrics for it for you, and I can’t believe how deep that feature goes, because I’m usually doing something a little obscure. There were just more of what I was looking for on UG. But there are a lot commenters on there that seem to be a little anal about the transcriptions in the key “they play it on the record” though. I’m gonna have it in the key that I can sing it in, if I take the trouble of transcribing something. But there’s also some good conductive criticisms and suggestions from other users. As far as bad transcriptions goes, yeah, there are a lot of those, but even bad ones can give you a place to start. Plus, you can always take a sad song, and make it better. Sorry, couldn’t help it. That was a reference to the 60’s rock band The Beatles, kids.

I do not like Ultimate guitar at all. Too many poor “transcriptions”, wrong chords, often wrong words, and simply a mess. Songsterr I found long ago, and while it is better, there are still issues - because, like UG, the material is submitted by people who may or may not know what they are doing…who may not understand exactly what is being played, sonically. So, I have my own ears, honed over 50 and more years in playing and transcribing music, knowing theory, and so understanding harmonic motion and relationships - what is actually going on sonically. I create my own transcriptions. On some occasions, when I’m feeling lazy, I’ll use Guitar Instructor because they have licensed official transcripts from the publishing houses/labels of the artists involved.
